Bluetooth 5.3, A2DP, LE | water_resist = IP68 [[dust]]/[[water]] resistant (up to 1.5m for 30 min) | other = | sar = | hac = | website = * {{URL|https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s24/|Galaxy S24 & S24+}} * {{URL|https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s24-ultra/|Galaxy S24 Ultra}} | references = {{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s24-12773.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S24|website= GSMArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s24+-12772.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S24+|website= GSMArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s24_ultra-12771.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra|website= GSMArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.samsung.com/in/smartphones/galaxy-s24/specs/|title= Galaxy S24 - Specs|last= |first= |date= 17 January 2024|website= Samsung Electronics|publisher= |access-date= |quote=}} }} The '''Samsung Galaxy S24''' is a series of high-end [[Android (operating system)|Android]]-based [[smartphone]]s designed, developed, manufactured, and marketed by [[Samsung Electronics]] as part of its flagship [[Samsung Galaxy S series|Galaxy S series]]. They collectively serve as the successor to the [[Samsung Galaxy S23]] series.{{Cite web |last=Spence |first=Ewan |title=How Samsung's Galaxy S24 Ultra Will Change Smartphones Forever |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/ewanspence/2024/01/10/samsung-galaxy-s24-ultra-secrets-camera-ai-decision-specs/ |access-date=2024-01-11 |website=[[Forbes]] |language=en}}{{Cite web |date=2024-01-10 |title=Here are all the cases Samsung will release for the Galaxy S24 series |url=https://www.androidauthority.com/samsung-galaxy-s24-series-official-cases-leak-3401702/ |access-date=2024-01-11 |website=Android Authority |language=en}} The phones were announced on January 17, 2024, at [[Galaxy Unpacked]], alongside Galaxy AI, in [[San Jose, California]]. The phones were subsequently released on January 31, 2024.{{Cite web |last=Martin |first=Alan |date=December 2, 2023 |title=Samsung Galaxy S24 specs: Everything we know so far |url=https://www.tomsguide.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s24-specs-everything-we-know-so-far |access-date=January 2, 2024 |website=Tom's Guide |language=en}}{{Cite news |last=Akhtar |first=Iyaz |date=January 2, 2024 |title=Samsung Galaxy S24 Unpacked Event Set for Jan. 17 |url=https://www.pcmag.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s24-unpacked-event-set-for-jan-17 |access-date=January 2, 2024 |magazine=[[PCMag]] |language=en-US}} == Lineup == The Galaxy S24 series includes three devices, which share the same lineup and screen sizes as the previous [[Samsung Galaxy S23|Galaxy S23]] series. The flagship Galaxy S24 features a flat 6.2-inch (155 mm) display. The Galaxy S24+ features similar hardware in a larger 6.7-inch (168 mm) form factor. At the top of the lineup, the Galaxy S24 Ultra features a flat 6.8-inch (173 mm) display. S24 and S24+ are powered by [[List of Qualcomm Snapdragon systems on chips#Snapdragon 8/8s Gen 3 (2024)|Snapdragon 8 Gen 3]] in the USA, Canada, China, Macau, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Japan while a [[Samsung Exynos]] 2400 is used in the rest of the world including South Korea, India and the Middle East. S24 Ultra is equipped with the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 in every market.{{Cite web |last=Schoon |first=Ben |date=2024-01-17 |title=Exynos returns to Galaxy S24 as Samsung ditches Snapdragon-only after just one year |url=https://9to5google.com/2024/01/17/samsung-galaxy-s24-exynos/ |access-date=2024-01-18 |website=9to5Google |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |date=2024-01-18 |title=Glaxy S24 Series:Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 vs Exynos 2400 Launch Countries|url=https://www.gizchina.com/2024/01/18/galaxy-s24-series-snapdragon-8-gen-3-vs-exynos-2400-launch-countries/ |access-date=2024-03-28 |website=Gizchina |language=en-US}} == Design == The Galaxy S24 and S24+ feature aluminum versions, and are available in four standard colors: Amber Yellow, Marble Gray, Cobalt Violet, and Onyx Black, with three additional colors available only through Samsung's website: Jade Green, Sapphire Blue and Sandstone Orange. The S24 Ultra features titanium versions of these colors. {| class="wikitable mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" ! colspan="3" style="text-align: center" |'''Galaxy S24''' ! colspan="3" style="text-align: center" |'''Galaxy S24+''' ! colspan="3" style="text-align: center" |'''Galaxy S24 Ultra''' |- !Color !Name !Online exclusive !Color !Name !Online exclusive !Color !Name !Online exclusive |- | bgcolor="#3e3e3e" | | Onyx Black | {{na}} | bgcolor="#3e3e3e" | | Onyx Black | {{na}} | bgcolor="#3e3e3e" | | Titanium Black | {{na}} |- | bgcolor="#c7c5c6" | | Marble Grey | {{na}} | bgcolor="#c7c5c6" | | Marble Grey | {{na}} | bgcolor="#c7c5c6" | | Titanium Grey | {{na}} |- | bgcolor="#f4e9cb" | | Amber Yellow | {{na}} | bgcolor="#f4e9cb" | | Amber Yellow | {{na}} | bgcolor="#f4e9cb" | | Titanium Yellow | {{na}} |- | bgcolor="#615c7a" | | Cobalt Violet | {{na}} | bgcolor="#615c7a" | | Cobalt Violet | {{na}} | bgcolor="#615c7a" | | Titanium Violet | {{na}} |- | bgcolor="#d9e5d1" | | Jade Green | {{ya}} | bgcolor="#d9e5d1" | | Jade Green | {{ya}} | bgcolor="#d9e5d1" | | Titanium Green | {{ya}} |- | bgcolor="#cbd1df" | | Sapphire Blue | {{ya}} | bgcolor="#cbd1df" | | Sapphire Blue | {{ya}} | bgcolor="#cbd1df" | | Titanium Blue | {{ya}} |- | bgcolor="#dc9c6e" | | Sandstone Orange | {{ya}} | bgcolor="#dc9c6e" | | Sandstone Orange | {{ya}} | bgcolor="#dc9c6e" | | Titanium Orange | {{ya}} |} == Specifications == === Hardware === ==== Chipset ==== The Galaxy S24 Ultra uses the [[Qualcomm Snapdragon|Qualcomm's Snapdragon]] 8 Gen 3 for Galaxy chip globally, whereas the S24 and S24+ use it only in the United States, Canada, [[China]], Hong Kong, Taiwan and Japan. The [[Exynos|Samsung Exynos]] 2400 is used elsewhere.{{Cite web|url=https://www.qualcomm.com/news/releases/2024/01/qualcomm-and-samsung-bring-the-most-advanced-snapdragon-ever-to-|title=Qualcomm and Samsung Bring the Most Advanced Snapdragon Ever to the 1st Galaxy AI Powered Smartphones, Galaxy S24 Series |date=17 January 2024|website=[[Qualcomm]]}}{{Cite web |title=Compare Samsung Galaxy S24 vs. Samsung Galaxy S24+ vs. Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra - GSMArena.com |url=https://www.gsmarena.com/compare.php3?idPhone1=12773&idPhone2=12772&idPhone3=12771 |access-date=2024-01-23 |website=www.gsmarena.com}} ==== Display ==== The Galaxy S24 series features a "Dynamic [[AMOLED]] 2X" display with [[HDR10+]] support, 2600 nits of peak brightness, and "dynamic tone mapping" technology.{{Cite web |title=What is a Dynamic AMOLED Screen?|url= https://www.samsung.com/uk/mobile-phone-buying-guide/what-is-dynamic-amoled-screen/ |access-date=2024-02-10 |website=samsung.com |language=en-US}} All models use an ultrasonic in-screen [[fingerprint sensor]]. The S24 series uses a variable refresh rate display with a range of 1 Hz{{Cite web |title=Samsung Galaxy S24 refresh rates|url= https://www.samsung.com/ae/support/mobile-devices/what-are-the-refresh-rates-and-ppi-for-the-new-s24-series/ |access-date=2024-02-10 |website=samsung.com |language=en-US}} or 24 Hz{{Cite web |title=Samsung Galaxy S24 review |url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s24-review-2663.php |access-date=2024-02-10 |website=GSMArena.com |language=en-US}} to 120 Hz.{{Cite web |date=2024-01-17 |title=Samsung Galaxy S24 vs Galaxy S23: Should you upgrade? |url=https://www.androidauthority.com/samsung-galaxy-s24-vs-galaxy-s23-3402588/ |access-date=2024-02-07 |website=Android Authority |language=en}} The Galaxy S24 Ultra uses [[Gorilla Glass|Corning Gorilla Glass]] Armor glass on its display, but it drops the curved sides seen in the Galaxy S23 Ultra.{{Cite web |title=Corning Gorilla Armor |url=https://www.corning.com/gorillaglass/worldwide/en/corning-gorilla-armor.html |access-date=2024-01-25 |website=www.corning.com |language=en-us}} {| class="wikitable" !Model ![[Display size]] ![[Display resolution|Resolution]] ![[Pixel density|Density]] ![[Display aspect ratio|Aspect ratio]] !Max [[refresh rate]] ![[Variable refresh rate]] !Shape |- |S24 |{{convert|6.2|in|0|abbr=on}} |2340×1080 |~416 ppi | rowspan="3" |19.5:9 | rowspan="3" |120 Hz | rowspan="3" |1 Hz to 120 Hz | rowspan="2" |Rounded corners, flat sides |- |S24+ |{{convert|6.7|in|0|abbr=on}} | rowspan="2" |3120×1440 |~513 ppi |- |S24 Ultra |{{convert|6.8|in|0|abbr=on}} |~505 ppi |Sharp corners, flat sides |} ==== Camera ==== The Galaxy S24 and S24+ have a 50 MP wide sensor, a 10 MP telephoto sensor and a 12 MP ultrawide sensor. The S24 Ultra has a 200 MP wide sensor, 50 MP 5× zoom periscope telephoto sensor, 10 MP telephoto sensor, and a 12 MP ultrawide sensor. The front camera uses a 12 MP sensor on all three models. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+Camera comparison on the Galaxy S24 series{{cite web |url= https://www.samsung.com/uk/mobile-phone-buying-guide/samsung-galaxy-s24-camera-specs-explained/|title= Samsung Galaxy S24 Camera Specs Explained|last= |first= |date= 17 January 2024|website= Samsung Electronics|publisher= |access-date= |quote=}} ! colspan="2" |Models !Galaxy S24 & S24+ !Galaxy S24 Ultra |- !Wide !Specs |50 MP, f/1.8, 23 mm, 1/1.56", Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS |200 MP, f/1.7, 23 mm, 1/1.3", PDAF, Laser AF, OIS |- !Ultrawide !Specs | colspan="2" |12 MP, f/2.2, 13 mm, 1/2.55", Dual Pixel PDAF on S24 Ultra |- !Telephoto !Specs |10 MP, f/2.4, 70 mm, 1/3.94", PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom |10 MP, f/2.4, 70 mm, 1/3.52", Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom |- ![[Periscope lens|Periscope Telephoto]] !Specs |– |50 MP, f/3.4, 115 mm, 1/2.52", Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS, 5x optical zoom |- !Front !Specs | colspan="2" |12 MP, f/2.2, 25 mm, PDAF |} ==== Batteries ==== The Galaxy S24, S24+, and S24 Ultra contain non-removable 4,000 mAh, 4,900 mAh, and 5,000 mAh [[Lithium-ion|Li-ion]] batteries respectively. The S24 only charges at 25 watts, while the S24+ and S24 Ultra charge up at 45 watts charging. ==== Connectivity ==== The Galaxy S24, and S24+ support [[5G]] SA/NSA/Sub6, [[Wi-Fi 6E]], and [[Bluetooth 5.3]] connectivity, while the Galaxy S24 Ultra additionally supports [[IEEE 802.11be|Wi-Fi 7]].{{Cite web |date=2024-01-17 |title=Samsung Galaxy S24 series specs: Everything you need to know |url=https://www.androidauthority.com/samsung-galaxy-s24-specs-3401897/ |access-date=2024-01-24 |website=Android Authority |language=en}} ==== Memory and storage ==== {| class="wikitable" ! rowspan="2" |Models ! colspan="2" |Galaxy S24 ! colspan="2" |Galaxy S24+ ! colspan="2" |Galaxy S24 Ultra |- ![[Random Access Memory|RAM]] !Storage ![[Random Access Memory|RAM]] !Storage ![[Random Access Memory|RAM]] !Storage |- !Variant 1 | rowspan="2" |8{{Nbsp}}GB |128{{Nbsp}}GB | – | – | rowspan="3" |12{{Nbsp}}GB |256{{Nbsp}}GB |- !Variant 2 | rowspan="2" |256{{Nbsp}}GB | rowspan="2" |12{{Nbsp}}GB |256{{Nbsp}}GB |512{{Nbsp}}GB |- !Variant 3 |12{{Nbsp}}GB |512{{Nbsp}}GB |1{{Nbsp}}TB |- !Variant 4 | 8{{Nbsp}}GB | 512{{Nbsp}}GB | – | – | - | - |} === Software === The Samsung Galaxy S24 phones were released with [[Android 14]] with Samsung's [[One UI]] 6.1 software. Samsung has promised 7 years of security patches and OS upgrades.{{Cite web |last=McGregor |first=Janhoi |title=Samsung Is Giving A Surprise Android Boost To All Galaxy S24 Owners |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jaymcgregor/2024/01/18/samsung-galaxy-s24-new-android-update-policy-seven-years/ |access-date=2024-01-18 |website=Forbes |language=en}} They use Google's on-device [[Gemini (language model)|Gemini Nano]], already used by their own [[Pixel 8 Pro]].{{Cite web |last=Akash |first=Sriram |date=January 17, 2024 |title=Samsung to embed Google's generative AI tech in S24 smartphone series |url=https://www.reuters.com/technology/samsung-embed-googles-generative-ai-tech-s24-smartphone-series-2024-01-17/ |website=[[Reuters]] |place=Bengaluru}} ==Reception== Some users noted that the Galaxy S24 Ultra's [[S Pen]] "absolutely reeks", with a smell that was likened to "burnt plastic". A moderator on Samsung's EU forums explained,{{Cite web|url=https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2024/03/users-complain-that-the-samsung-galaxy-s24-stylus-smells-bad/|title=Samsung users ask, "Why does the S-Pen smell so bad?"|date=March 23, 2024|access-date=April 21, 2024|website=[[Ars Technica]]|last=Amadeo|first=Ron}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2024/3/22/24108848/samsung-galaxy-s24-ultra-s-pen-stylus-smell|title=Confirmed: the S Pen smells kind of bad|date=March 23, 2024|access-date=April 23, 2024|website=[[The Verge]]|last=Johnson|first=Allison}} {{Blockquote|text=This isn’t anything to be concerned about. While the S Pen is in its holster, it is close to the internal components of the phone, which will generate heat while in use, and cause the plastic to heat up. This can smell like burning, but it is similar to the smell you might experience after leaving your car in the sun for a few hours. The seats and plastic fittings in the vehicle might smell hot, but this will diminish after it cools.}} == See also == * [[Samsung Galaxy S series]] * [[List of longest smartphone telephoto lenses]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s24/ Galaxy S24 & S24+] – Official website * [https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s24-ultra/ Galaxy S24 Ultra] – Official website {{S-start}} {{S-bef| before = [[Samsung Galaxy S23]]}} {{S-ttl| title = Samsung Galaxy S24| years = 2024}} {{S-inc| recent}} {{S-end}} {{Samsung phones}} {{Samsung Galaxy S|smartphones=yes|tablets =yes}} [[Category:Android (operating system) devices]] [[Category:Samsung Galaxy]] [[Category:Flagship smartphones]] [[Category:Samsung smartphones]] [[Category:Mobile phones with multiple rear cameras]] [[Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2024]] [[Category:Phablets]] [[Category:Mobile phones with 4K video recording]] [[Category:Mobile phones with 8K video recording]]
